Description: Lower body sherd of Chian Mature Animal or Grand Style pottery heavy chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black with two pairs of added white bands above tip of lotus bud in white outline with added red centre; exterior: seven bands.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

There is very little decoration on the sherd that can help determine to what style it belongs. The thickness of the sherd suggest that it may have come from a chalice krater. Chalice kraters belong to the Mature Animal and Grand Styles.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1624) (phase 2)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: ucl np 55 (Other Accession Number)
